page.title: 14STOKE BARDOLPH SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: { Stoke Bardolph Water Reclaimation {Works}is the seventh largest in the country, and serves a population of { {456,000 people}in the drainage area of almost 84 square miles (21,750 ha). The site covers 75 acres (30 ha) and treats an{average flow}of{154,000 {cubic metres}of sewage each day. About one sixth of this is made up of trade effluents from the textile industry, metal finishing, chemical and pharma- ceutical manufacturing and the food processing industry. The works uses the{activated sludge and {heated digestion}processes in which bacteria digest th sewage. The { {methane gas}produced provides 75% of the power for the works; all the {digested sludge}is pumped to the 1600 acre (650 ha) Stoke Bardolph Estate as fertilizer; and the{clear effluent}is discharged into the River Trent.
